instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi i have macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> touchbar and kay boord not working 
no liquid , can you hal me pleas

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No liquid, but there should be some history fault.

Trackpad works correctly?
Check 3V3 and 5V power rails of J6700.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: 3V3 and 5V power rails of J6700 is ok. trackpad not work 0

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad board/flex.
Be sure R/L6700 are both good.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: 12v arriva nella <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR>, ma nella j6701 12v non arriva dalla <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: 12v arrives in the <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR>, but in the j6701 12v does not arrive from the <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
So <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR> is bad; replace it.
First be sure, no short to ground on its pin 2; check w/ and w/o TP connected.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: now i have 12v on j6701 but it doesn't work again! CAN IT DEPEND ON THE <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Trackpad works good now?
Both touchbar and keyboard not working?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
There should be a reason <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR> got burnt.
Try known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: ma se scollego il trackpad la tastiera deve funzionare

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: but if I unplug the trackpad the keyboard must work

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: but if I unplug the trackpad the keyboard must work, but the keyboard doesn't work either

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  bord <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
STOP to make wrong assumptions!!!
Keyboard information goes to PCH through trackpad...
